title: Is this supposed to be how thresh Q works?

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body: As far as i know this should not have happened and is not the intended way for thresh's Q to work, thoughts?

replies.body: That wall is incredibly thin, movement abilities can go through walls if they're thin enough unless specifically coded otherwise. The movement that Thresh Q forces on an opponent appears to be long enough to make that crossing so I'd say it's intended.

Im pretty sure that specific wall has been bugged since the beginning of time.

For instance, if  you time it perfectly and find the exact position on the wall, Vayne can tumble over it, Kled can dash through it, and pretty much any champ who has a dash or a pull which is supposed to not be able to go through walls, can go through that wall.

I believe the difference lies in "not able to go through walls" and "not long enough to go through walls". That wall right there at that spot is the thinnest wall in the game, so many displacement abilities that would normally be unable to go through walls since they don't generate enough distance can go through that one. Any displacement ability can take you over a wall if it's small enough (unless otherwise specified).

It's essentially the difference between getting your cursor all the way over the wall and flashing it successfully, or not moving your cursor far enough and smacking face first into the wall instead. Flash can take you over walls alright, but if you don't make it long enough it's not going to.

You wouldn't practically use Sion's ult to get over a wall with that last little dash but, that doesn't mean it's impossible/unintended.

Its like hecarim using his e to get over walls, he is not supposed to and it hard to, but it is a valid mechanic.

This thresh pull also doesn't have to do with just that wall bing super thin, it also works on wolves wall, the other river wall, the gates and drag wall.

I wasn't aware the thresh one was long enough to go through other walls, though it is fair long the more I think about it :P Can't say I've ever tried but it would be an interesting thing. Rather gives you incentive to stand just a little back from the wall ey.
